column4: i need help, linux wont detect my floppy drive, i think its because of my drivers when my HD was reformated, but on dell support site they only have the driver for windows

i need help, linux wont detect my floppy drive, i think its because of my drivers when my HD was reformated, but on dell support site they only have the driver for windows
i need help, linux wont detect my floppy drive, i think its because of my drivers when my HD was reformated, but on dell support site they only have the driver for windows

Linux doesn't need drivers. It has everything built into it. So, if it doesn't work, something's wrong with either Hardware detection or your kernel. Try mounting /dev/fb0 to /media/floppy (don't forget to create that folder)
Just one thing: you need to type /msg nickserv register <password> before you can PM anybody here on IRC
and don't forget the '/'. It's really important! if you don't, all will be able to read it
i know, im not a n00b, i had my own server b4 lolz
You might just improve your speech there.
